long.1: Developer Log - One of my biggest projects. I did it more for myself than for other people, because I did not find a normal platform where I could share knowledge.
long.2: I spent a little more than a year developing this blog (this version is already the 3rd iteration), the main audience comes to this blog from other portals. This project is the accumulation of my knowledge from different industries.

long.1: Capybara is a cross-platform code review application designed to make the process of code review easier.
long.2: The application has integration with Github and Gitlab, and can also work standalone with a local repository.

purpose.backend: The programming language I use for the backend

home.title: Developer log
home.description: Development log through the eyes of a developer
home.hero: Developer Log - A blog that a developer writes for other developers. Here are articles and notes about modern web technologies and development methods. I share my experience, knowledge and provide accessible guides to dive into the world of development from basics to advanced techniques. The peculiarity of the blog is a clear presentation of complex topics for a wide audience. Stay up to date with the latest trends and improve your skills with the Developer Log.
home.subtitle: Go to reading

posts.searchPlaceholder: Find a post by title, description, or tag...

author.me: I am an experienced front-end developer with over four years of successful experience building and improving applications. My skills and knowledge cover a wide range of modern web technologies, which allows me to develop high quality and intuitive applications.
author.pursuit: I aim to continue to grow as a front-end developer by contributing to the development of modern and innovative web applications. I actively blog, and also write on VC, Habr and Telegram.
author.role: My role included developing and maintaining web applications, making them responsive and cross-browser compatible, and integrating with backend services. I actively participated in architectural decisions and always strive to improve development processes.
